comments:
Build used: CDT 3.0.0 I200506141049

Failed to rename a class in Sort project, test steps are as following:


Refactoring  a Class

- Expand the BubbleSort directory in the Sort project.  Enable the auto-build 
feature by selecting Project -> Build Automatically. 
- Open the SD_01.h file. 
- From the Outline view, right-click on the class SD_01 and select Refactor-
>Rename. 
- Change the name from SD_01 to BubbleSort and click the OK button. 
- Verify that a successful build is executed post refactor. 
- From the Outline view, right-click on the class SD_01 and select Refactor-
>Undo Rename SD_01 


After Preview, you can see a list is generated, clicking on some items in the 
list generates the Internal Error. Click on OK, an error message pops up and 
it fails. Same Internal Error was generated again as below:

Tried to attach Sort project, but it's too large even zipped. Let me know and 
I will email to whoever needs it.

Tried on I200506291405 build again and still got same thing. But so far I can 
only reproduce it on Project Sort(which I consider it's mid-size).

Also added some folks to CC list.

Project Sort is too large to attach, will be provided upon request.

I was not able to reproduce the problem with your sample code.
It might be a consequence of 
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=102329
as this problem causes binaries to be searched. Please try to
use the patch provided.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 114153 ***
This is not a dup of 114153 (although the resolution could look pretty similar). But the problem of this PR is probably fixed with the fix for bug 116034.
With the fix for bug 102329 the rename refactoring stopped suggesting changes for binary files. With the fix for 116034 even that would not be a problem.
